alert.note: Alert for Anchorage (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued November 07 at 4:06PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues to be possible. * WHERE...Anchorage Bowl. This includes the cities of Anchorage, Eagle River, Indian, And Eklutna. * WHEN...From Wednesday evening through Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Snow Wednesday will likely change to rain by Wednesday evening with 0.5" to 1.0" of rain possible. Rain on top of snow will lead to ponding of water on area of roadways. Excessive runoff may result in flooding of low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rain may fall on the existing snowpack leading to increased runoff. Flows in rivers may increase quickly and reach impactful levels. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood - Storm drains should be kept clear of debris as much as possible.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop. Stay tuned to further developments on weather.gov/Anchorage or by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
